subject: Update allocations for failed over instances
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2018-11-14 09:26:52.000000000', 'files': ['compute_hyperv/nova/utils/__init__.py', 'compute_hyperv/tests/unit/cluster/test_clusterops.py', 'compute_hyperv/nova/cluster/clusterops.py', 'compute_hyperv/nova/utils/placement.py', 'compute_hyperv/tests/unit/utils/test_placement.py', 'compute_hyperv/tests/unit/utils/__init__.py'], 'message': "Update allocations for failed over instances

This change ensures that we're updating the allocations stored in
the placement service when handling instance failovers.

For proper scheduling, the placement service needs to have an
accurate view of the resource providers.

We're using the 1.12 (Queens) Placement API version, making this patch
easy to backport.

Change-Id: Ie155ab280609ccff310c82c68dcdcbe3c4fc7f95
Closes-Bug: #1800437
"}]
commit_message:
Update allocations for failed over instances

This change ensures that we're updating the allocations stored in
the placement service when handling instance failovers.

For proper scheduling, the placement service needs to have an
accurate view of the resource providers.

We're using the 1.12 (Queens) Placement API version, making this patch
easy to backport.

Change-Id: Ie155ab280609ccff310c82c68dcdcbe3c4fc7f95
Closes-Bug: #1800437

commit_message:
Fix server query examples

The 'locked' query parameter is not supported
in the "List Servers Detailed" API.
So replace examples using the 'locked' query parameter
with examples using another query parameters.

Closes-Bug: #1801904

commit_message:
Run tempest.api.identity tests as a basic test in all CI

* when all test_regex present in whitelist file and are also in
  blacklist file that time tempest does not have any tests to run
  which leads to exit error and resulted in failing the CI job.
* Adding a minimal test through regex will help to run some test
  for sanity.
* Identity tests are pretty straight forward.

Change-Id: Icdb9ad5b91de3e902b8b5d309ce13e3176c4a226
Closes-Bug:#1803547

commit_message:
Skip double word hacking test

Because of a change [1] in the tokenize package in the stdlib of
recent pythons, one of the tests for the hacking checks can fail.
This change skips the test on newer pythons and leaves a TODO
to fix it.

[1] see https://bugs.python.org/issue33899 and
    https://bugs.python.org/issue35107

Change-Id: I64744a8144fcf630eea609eb2b2d14974f4fd4bb
Related-Bug: #1804062

We've disabled os-collect-config after config-download became
the default from rocky. However, this workflow is currently using
heat software deployment for deploy_ssh_key task. This changes to
use inventory generated by config-download and removes the
deploy_ssh_key task.

Also fixes swift_ring.v1.reblance to use the correct inventory.

Change-Id: Iab9d30e1b5b3008ef3130f64225b4f7fd4082214
Closes-Bug: #1803814
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rotate_fernet_keys workflow to not use heat deployment

We've disabled os-collect-config after config-download became
the default from rocky. However, this workflow is currently using
heat software deployment for deploy_ssh_key task. This changes to
use inventory generated by config-download and removes the
deploy_ssh_key task.

Also fixes swift_ring.v1.reblance to use the correct inventory.

Change-Id: Iab9d30e1b5b3008ef3130f64225b4f7fd4082214
Closes-Bug: #1803814

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2424, 'name': 'Felipe Reyes', 'email': 'felipe.reyes@canonical.com', 'username': 'freyes'}, {'_account_id': 6737, 'name': 'Edward Hope-Morley', 'email': 'edward.hope-morley@canonical.com', 'username': 'hopem'}, {'_account_id': 20634, 'name': 'Chris MacNaughton', 'email': 'chris.macnaughton@canonical.com', 'username': 'Chris.MacNaughton'}, {'_account_id': 20635, 'name': 'Ryan Beisner', 'email': 'ryanbeisner@gmail.com', 'username': 'ryan-beisner'}, {'_account_id': 20648, 'name': 'Canonical CI', 'email': 'uosci-testing-bot@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'uosci-testing-bot', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24297, 'name': 'Shane Peters', 'email': 'twofiveninja@gmail.com', 'username': 'shaner'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2018-11-16 07:36:01.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/ceph_hooks.py', 'unit_tests/test_ceph_hooks.py', 'templates/ceph.conf', 'config.yaml'], 'message': 'Add disable-pg-max-object-skew option

Openstack clouds that use ceph will typically start their life with
at least one pool (glance) loaded with a disproportionately high
amount of data/objects where other pools may remain empty. This can
trigger a HEALTH_WARN if mon_pg_warn_max_object_skew is exceeded
but that is actually a false positive.

Change-Id: I5a535dbb17db2149630d971d85ac311f14298b09
Closes-Bug: 1720374
'}]
commit_message:
Add disable-pg-max-object-skew option

Openstack clouds that use ceph will typically start their life with
at least one pool (glance) loaded with a disproportionately high
amount of data/objects where other pools may remain empty. This can
trigger a HEALTH_WARN if mon_pg_warn_max_object_skew is exceeded
but that is actually a false positive.

Change-Id: I5a535dbb17db2149630d971d85ac311f14298b09
Closes-Bug: 1720374

commit_message:
Adapt code to newer code style (linters)

Makes those files conformant with current linting rules and avoids
linting errors when we need to toch them again.

Previous doing "pre-commit run -a" uncovered these errors, now is no
longer reporting any other errors.

Change-Id: Ie4cf229c8f11c2b55b323eac23c89483b26d3781

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Ie8221091ed7971b6bcaf390049410b7e6868eb5c
Story: #2004073
Task: #27462

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-29 12:56:07.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I88cbc53bc16860b266cefcf9aa8e0811e8af8ae9
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I88cbc53bc16860b266cefcf9aa8e0811e8af8ae9

commit_message:
Make neutron-fullstack job run py3

In the Neutron CI meeting on 2018-10-02 [1] we decided on the proper
approach for fullstack testing of Neutron in Zuul.  The approach is:

1. There should be only one fullstack CI job, named "neutron-fullstack"
2. The neutron-fullstack job should invoke python3 in tox.ini

This change implements the agreed-upon approach.
Switching the nodeset to newer OS will be handled in a separate step

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_ci/2018/neutron_ci.2018-10-02-16.00.html

Co-Authored-By: Nate Johnston <nate.johnston@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I37c1cb42b3a94532e7b7fea21a929a39fe63f00b

'}]
commit_message:
Import neutron.db.api module in common.utils

Patch [1] removed import of neutron.db.api module in
neutron.common.utils.
This cause some issues e.g. in networking-ovn projects because
listeners:

@event.listens_for(orm.session.Session, "persistent_to_deleted")
on _persistent_to_deleted() function [2] and

@event.listens_for(model_base.BASEV2, "attribute_instrument", propagate=True)
on _listen_for_changes() function [3]

aren't created as they where before.

This patch adds import of this neutron.db.api module again just to
ensure that those listeners are created properly.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614252/
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/api.py#L110
[3] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/api.py#L134

Closes-Bug: #1802369

Change-Id: I3e427ee5c904c34115aaf1afa67e1109ea58d603

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-08-16 06:50:00.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Idbe1bf1715033cb28e822043601e5e6630be387d
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Idbe1bf1715033cb28e822043601e5e6630be387d

change. Let us add a job to not let this happen again.

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6da7dbcdb4a11622751c6e19592cf834276e1cde

subject: DVR: Centralized FloatingIPs are not cleared after migration.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13995, 'name': 'Nate Johnston', 'email': 'nate.johnston@redhat.com', 'username': 'natejohnston'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-11-15 19:04:04.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_dvrscheduler_db.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/framework.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_ha_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_router.py'], 'message': 'DVR: Centralized FloatingIPs are not cleared after migration.

With DVR routers, if a port is associated with a FloatingIP,
before it is used by a VM, the FloatingIP will be initially
started at the Network Node SNAT Namespace, since the port
is not bound to any host.

Then when the port is attached to a VM, the port gets its
host binding, and then the FloatingIP setup should be migrated
to the Compute host and the original FloatingIP in the Network
Node SNAT Namespace should be cleared.

But the original FloatingIP setup in SNAT Namespace was not
cleared by the agent.

This patch addresses the issue.

Change-Id: I55a16bcc0020087aa1abe76f5bc85cd64ccdaecd
Closes-Bug: #1796491
(cherry picked from commit cd0cc47a6ab0f7968a8c24e9d477909c45e4ae87)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Centralized FloatingIPs are not cleared after migration.

With DVR routers, if a port is associated with a FloatingIP,
before it is used by a VM, the FloatingIP will be initially
started at the Network Node SNAT Namespace, since the port
is not bound to any host.

Then when the port is attached to a VM, the port gets its
host binding, and then the FloatingIP setup should be migrated
to the Compute host and the original FloatingIP in the Network
Node SNAT Namespace should be cleared.

But the original FloatingIP setup in SNAT Namespace was not
cleared by the agent.

This patch addresses the issue.

Change-Id: I55a16bcc0020087aa1abe76f5bc85cd64ccdaecd
Closes-Bug: #1796491
(cherry picked from commit cd0cc47a6ab0f7968a8c24e9d477909c45e4ae87)

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-11-20 02:56:09.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I1e198979f7834dddf74c7ff1ecde308013c6d656
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I1e198979f7834dddf74c7ff1ecde308013c6d656

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ie4462a540b9d70017b9e3a5f7110c71be080492f

commit_message:
Move ARA install to end of bootstrap

setup_ara sets up the callback plugins variable
so as it is now, it gets unset during the role
retrieval.  This commit moves it to the end of
bootstrap so that the ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS
is set.

Change-Id: I46ceb2acf377e38b2dc31ffc4a82b7945f8dd4c5
(cherry picked from commit 93831a60915d899e00c0eaa00a1e8b5511de3e88)

commit_message:
fix DBResourceExtendFixture fixture

Commit e5afd0b9cbd5b60d477d19ebcfb7b1ba71aeb694 rehomed the
resource_extend db module into neutron-lib and included a testing
fixture. However the fixture submitted in that commit incorrectly
backed-up/restored the _DECORATED_EXTEND_METHODS rather than the
_resource_extend_functions as it should've. This patch fixes that
issue.

Change-Id: I6f313d8b03cbe985a2f231e99c4b6c0d1af7a8c4

commit_message:
Remove build-openstack-api-ref jobs

The api-ref-jobs has been added
since Ia4680f24d78af1260f2f0106a458b78a079c1287.
It includes build-openstack-api-ref jobs in check and gate.

So remove the build-openstack-api-ref job definitions
in .zuul.yaml because they are unnecessary.

Change-Id: I4b612fa87609240bd0a0f838163ee87c45a41a46

subject: Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-16 02:17:38.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I69dfc2ef3d7a458e579fc82fb22a0d7867161d77
Story: #2004073
Task: #27453
"}]
commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I69dfc2ef3d7a458e579fc82fb22a0d7867161d77
Story: #2004073
Task: #27453
